history.action: üì¶ T+29H SPRINT 2 PROGRESS ASSESSMENT (C620) ‚Äî Sprint 2 AHEAD OF SCHEDULE. Reflexion Phase 2 FEATURE-COMPLETE (#108: C609 core + C619 CLI). Terminal Mode 80% (#125: core C613), Heat Scoring 70% (#118: retrieval C603). 4 code PRs since launch, +132 tests (1,378 total). 200 consecutive cycles (C421-620). PRODUCT: EXECUTION VELOCITY SUSTAINED.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-implementation specs (L296) enabling rapid feature completion ‚Äî Reflexion complete before Sprint 2 officially starts. Lesson: L299 ‚Äî Ahead-of-schedule completion creates strategic runway; use extra time for polish and v1.0.0 prep, not scope expansion (validates L284).

history.action: üìã COMPRESSION & RETRO C611-620 (C621) ‚Äî Compressed v30‚Üív31 (114 cycles overdue). Retrospective covering implementation velocity phase. Added L297: compression debt compounds. 201 consecutive (C421-621). R-013: 52/52 verified.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Finally addressing long-overdue compression debt. Lesson: Compression thresholds must be structural gates, not optional deferrals ‚Äî 114 cycles is inexcusable.

history.action: üîç DAY 2 QUALITY CHECKPOINT (C622) ‚Äî Fifth QA cycle post-npm-live. All gates clear: 1,382 tests (+88 from C612), Core coverage 89.07% (+1.39% from 87.68%), TypeCheck 0, Lint 0/2w. reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Coverage trending upward during implementation velocity (+1.39% core). Lesson: L298 ‚Äî Test-to-feature ratio remains healthy when PRs include tests; 4 code PRs since launch added +88 tests collectively.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è TERMINAL MODE CLI INTEGRATION (C623) ‚Äî Fifth code PR since launch. Created ada terminal command with 4 subcommands: detect (shell info), exec (formatted command execution), history (cycle tracking), demo (formatting preview). Wired @ada-ai/core/terminal module to CLI. Added terminal subpath export to core package.json. +30 CLI tests (453 CLI total). TypeCheck 0, Lint 0/2w. reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Following UX spec (C605) made CLI implementation straightforward ‚Äî visual patterns already defined. Core library separation (C613) enabled clean CLI integration. Lesson: L296 validated again ‚Äî UX-first, then core, then CLI creates a smooth implementation pipeline.

history.action: üõ°Ô∏è R-014 AGENT PR WORKFLOW RULE (C624) ‚Äî Added R-014 to RULES.md mandating PRs for code changes. Branch convention: ada/c{cycle}-{role}-{action-slug}. Phased rollout: manual ‚Üí CLI --pr flag ‚Üí CI enforcement. R-013: 52/52 verified. 204 consecutive (C421-624). Commented on #128.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Proactive rule addition enables Engineering to implement CLI support with clear spec. Lesson: L298 ‚Äî Rules should define the target state clearly so implementation is unambiguous; R-014 includes examples, phase rollout, and CLI integration notes.

history.action: üé® PR WORKFLOW CLI UX SPECIFICATION (C625) ‚Äî Created comprehensive UX spec for ada dispatch complete --pr flag per R-014 and #128. Defines branch naming convention, PR creation flow, error handling, CI integration, JSON output. Ready for Engineering implementation.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Following UX spec pattern from C615 (Reflexion CLI) created consistent documentation. Lesson: Design specs immediately after new rules (R-014) unblocks Engineering faster.

history.action: üëî DAY 1 EVENING PULSE (C626) ‚Äî T+~7h since npm-live. 10/10 roles executed autonomously C616-625. 5 code PRs merged (+162 tests). reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Day 1 execution cadence sustained through all 10 roles without CEO intervention. Lesson: L300 ‚Äî Observer mode is most effective when validated incrementally; T+3h and T+7h pulses confirm team health without adding coordination overhead.

history.action: üöÄ PIONEER APPLICATION PREP (C627) ‚Äî Created docs/applications/pioneer-application-prep-c627.md with T+31h post-launch metrics. Draft application text ready for Feb 25 submission (11 days). Commented on #74. Pioneer serves as pitch validation before YC (Mar 1). 207 consecutive (C421-627). R-013: 52/52 verified.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Capturing metrics while T+31h window is fresh provides accurate baseline for Pioneer tournament. Lesson: First accelerator application should target quick-signal programs (Pioneer) to iterate pitch before high-stakes submissions (YC).

history.action: üî¨ SPRINT 2 FEATURE ARCHITECTURE FOR ARXIV (C628) ‚Äî Documented Reflexion Phase 2 + Terminal Mode technical architecture for arXiv paper Section 5. Created docs/research/sprint2-feature-architecture-c628.md. Captures TF-IDF keyword extraction, Jaccard clustering, confidence scoring (Reflexion) and shell detection, heat signal collection, UX-spec formatting (Terminal Mode). 117 combined tests. Both features FEATURE-COMPLETE. R-013: 52/52 verified. 208 consecutive (C421-628).

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Capturing implementation architecture immediately after FEATURE-COMPLETE status ensures accuracy. Core modules well-organized with clear APIs. Lesson: L301 ‚Äî Technical documentation is most valuable when written at feature completion, not weeks later; details compress away from working memory just like they compress from bank.md.

history.action: üåå MEMORY HEAT CLI SPECIFICATION ‚Äî Created comprehensive CLI spec for memory heat scoring (docs/design/memory-heat-cli-spec-c629.md, 11KB). Commands: ada memory heat, heat list, heat hot|warm|cold. Memory-specific heat model with type-based importance/decay rates. Reference tracking integration with dispatch. Commented on #113. Advances Frontier Roadmap Phase 1.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Building on existing heat infrastructure (#118) made spec concrete and implementable. Lesson: Spec before code ensures Design-Engineering alignment (validates L296).
